Issues.Title: Accessibility: Narrator cannot focus entire texts and announce "Document selected" when pressing Ctrl+A to choose all texts in ComboBox
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 8.0: 8.0.100-rtm.23477.34

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this issue can repro in .Net 6.0 and .Net 7.0.

### Issue description

When using keyboard: Ctrl+A or mouse to choose all texts in ComboBox, Narrator cannot focus entire texts and announce "Document selected" to user.

The original issue: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9828

The result in .Net 8.0 RC2 latest build:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/cbf91203-fa2d-428a-a16b-64b1ad2f5b6c)
![test80trm](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/b193cd15-df1d-4536-a89c-3120b73458af)

The result in .Net framework:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/9570f1a0-484e-45c4-91e2-bb0632531251)
![test481framework](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/86937911/6d23710f-ef74-4729-8964-3d97f71a2ec7)



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a winforms .Net Core application.
2. Add a ComboBox control to form designer with text.
3. Build and run.
4. Use Narrator to focus on the individual text, then presse Ctrl+A to select all texts.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility: Narrator cannot focus entire texts and announce "Document selected" when pressing Ctrl+A to choose all texts in ComboBox" (#10007)

Issues.Title: Simplify Cursor code
Issues.Body:
Construction of Cursors statics had gotten a bit over complicated. ToString() was also very expensive when creating Cursors from handles.

The core of the change is to pass the property name when constructing a Cursor from Cursors for consistency and performance.

These changes will also allow making the CursorConverter reflection free in the future.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10005)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Simplify Cursor code" (#10005)

Issues.Title: After clicking on a component control on the Manually Align Controls by hand page of the DemoConsole application, it fails to focus on other controls.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works well in .Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Issue description

In the Align Controls by hand page of the [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test application in the Winforms repo, clicking on the component control does not focus on other controls.


### Steps to reproduce

Actual result in DemoConsole application when **testing main branch**:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/22b8bb87-cfd8-4627-b9fe-786484f1e9e6

Expected result in DemoConsole application when **testing release/8.0 branch**:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/355e2ec7-59b9-4d0b-aa29-0f7b94332606
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "After clicking on a component control on the Manually Align Controls by hand page of the DemoConsole application, it fails to focus on other controls." (#9989)

Issues.Title: Update FlowLayoutPanelDesigner.cs and ToolStripContainerDesigner.cs
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #9989 


## Proposed changes

- Add judgement before invoking function "ContainerParent" in file ToolStripContainerDesigner.cs
- Add missing property "FlowDirection"  and "InheritanceAttribute" from VS repo to FlowLayoutPanelDesigner.cs

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- All of the control can be selected normally in Demo project

## Regression? 

- Yes  

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/22b8bb87-cfd8-4627-b9fe-786484f1e9e6

### After
![AfterChanges](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/132890443/6a544ccd-2f8d-4bea-8262-a87dac10b598)




## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .net 9.0.0-alpha.1.23470.17


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update FlowLayoutPanelDesigner.cs and ToolStripContainerDesigner.cs" (#10000)

Issues.Title: Don't invalidate Cursors cursors (#9994)
Issues.Body:
### Port of #9994

DO NOT REBASE/SQUASH

Our static Cursors should never be disposed. This was a regression for the ones wrapped around system cursors. Our own resource cursors were never properly guarded, this fixes them.

Issues.Title: Don't invalidate Cursors cursors
Issues.Body:
Our static Cursors should never be disposed. This was a regression for the ones wrapped around system cursors. Our own resource cursors were never properly guarded, this fixes them.

Fixes #9985


## Proposed changes

- Don't dispose Cursor instances we shouldn't dispose

## Customer Impact

- Without this any code can dispose of the Cursors statics, making them unusable
- There is no workaround without using reflection

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

Issues.Title: The icon property of the NotifyIcon control cannot be modified in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it doesn't work in .Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, when changing the icon property of the NotifyIcon control, cannot be modified.

**Actual result** in [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/56664234/dab536e8-e545-4370-a641-0008ba2bc5a8


**Expected result:**
When changing the icon property of the NotifyIcon control, can be modified.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/56664234/df710638-e2e2-477a-85da-5dd0f85c5f1f

### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The icon property of the NotifyIcon control cannot be modified in DemoConsole application " (#9999)

Issues.Title: Component controls in Component tray should not be modified when TabOrder is enabled in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it doesn't work in .Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, when enabling "Tab Order", the component tray controls in component tray still can  be modified: open smart tag window to edit. --- it is not expected.

**Actual result in [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app**:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/7f1a4097-3682-48e2-9cef-79d312067b0c)
![TabOrder_ActualInDemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/3b507b49-0efa-437c-9467-ecee248d0d73)

**Expected result:**
when enabling "Tab Order", component tray controls in component tray cannot be focused to modify.
![TabOrder_expected](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/0c552e3c-8b15-474b-aaff-a333d54fe31e)


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Component controls in Component tray should not be modified when TabOrder is enabled in DemoConsole application" (#9997)

Issues.Title: Fix thread-safety issue of reading last accessed index in `ImageList.ImageCollection.IndexOfKey`
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

When multiple threads call `Images.IndexOfKey`, it is possible to get `System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: 'Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection. (Parameter 'index')` exception when one of the calls returns -1.

Debugging this, the first `IsValidIndex` check passes, but the `_imageInfoCollection[]` accessor throws, which should not be possible, especially when the collection is not modified.

Another thing that could be optimized is removing the double list accessor by doing `_imageInfoCollection[i] is {} image`, so that next `SafeCompareStrings` call does not read from the list again.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- None


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9986)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix thread-safety issue of reading last accessed index in `ImageList.ImageCollection.IndexOfKey`" (#9986)

Issues.Title: Exception in .Net Core(5.0/6.0/7.0) when Corsor of Form is Disposed
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.Net Core 3.1 works, 
.Net Core 5.0, 6.0, 7.0 doesn't work
.Net Core 8.0 seems to work

### Issue description

When the Cursor of a Form gets Disposed, then there are endless exceptions and the App may even crash.
This didn't happen in the .Net Framework, and doesn't seems to happen in .Net Core 3.1 or 8.0 Preview.
This Exception seems to happen in .Net Core 5.0, 6.0 & 7.0

As far as I tracked this back, the Problem seems that in the FW when the cursor is set, then it uses the internal Value of 'System.Windows.Forms.handle', and .Net Core 7.0 seems to use 'System.Windows.Forms.Handle'.
'System.Windows.Forms.handle' throws a exception when System.Windows.Forms.handle is IntPtr.Zero.

This is even more problematic when (acidently) any one of teh Cursors returned by the 'System.Windows.Forms.Cursors'-Properties gets Disposed, since they are used internal and there is no way to replace the Disposed Cursors with Not Disposed ones, prevent the Dispose or react to the Dispose (No Event)

### Steps to reproduce

1.) Create a New WinForms Project.
2.) Add a Button
3.) Add this Click-Event Code:
`
    Private Sub Button1_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
        Dim cur As Cursor
        cur = System.Windows.Forms.Cursors.Default
        Me.Cursor = cur
        Me.Cursor.Dispose()
    End Sub
`
4.) Click the Button and move the Mousecursor around the Form
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Exception in .Net Core(5.0/6.0/7.0) when Corsor of Form is Disposed" (#9985)
